page.title: 14FERHAM HOUSE
page.content: Ferham House is the local health centre for several districts in Rotherham including Ferham, Masborough, Holmes, Kimberworth, and Catcliffe. There are a lot of people based at the health centre including five school nurses, seven health visitors, twenty district nurses and fifteen doctors. A typical day for the school nurse would would involve visits to perhaps three schools to check on sight, weight hearing and height then several visits to children's houses to check on individual medical needs and finally working at one of the clinics that are held in Ferham House. The clinics that are heald daily there include speech therapy, hearing, eyes, dental, chiropidist and baby clinics.
